alert.note: Alert for Madera; Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 19 at 10:23PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Madera and Mariposa. * WHEN...Until 130 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1023 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Madera and South Central Mariposa Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
